tax.text: No personal income tax payable up to an income of ₹12 lakh under the new regime.
Salaried taxpayers benefit from a standard deduction of ₹75,000, increasing the tax-free limit to ₹12.75 lakh.
The new tax structure aims to reduce middle-class taxes, boosting household consumption, savings, and investment.
Efforts continue to simplify taxes, improve taxpayer services, and reduce litigation.
58% of corporate tax comes from the simplified tax regime in FY23.
More than two-thirds of taxpayers availed the simplified personal income tax regime in FY24.
The fiscal deficit is estimated to be 4.4% of GDP for 2025-26.
Net tax receipts are projected at ₹28.37 lakh crore.
Gross market borrowings are estimated at ₹14.82 lakh crore.
The total expenditure for 2025-26 is projected at ₹50.65 lakh crore.

education.text: The government has allocated ₹500 crore to establish a Centre of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence for education.
An expansion plan aims to add 10,000 medical education seats, targeting 75,000 additional seats over the next five years.
The PM SVANidhi scheme will be revamped to provide enhanced loans, UPI-linked credit cards, and capacity-building support.
E-vouchers will be provided directly to 1 lakh students annually, offering a 3% interest subvention on education loans up to ₹10 lakh.
The Department of School Education and Literacy has been allocated ₹78,571.30 crore for 2025-26.
The Department of Higher Education receives ₹50,067.68 crore in the current budget.
The government plans to establish Centers of Excellence in Artificial Intelligence across educational institutions.
A National Digital Library for Children and Adolescents will be set up to facilitate access to quality books across geographies, languages, and genres.
To promote regional languages, the National Book Trust will provide books in regional languages and English to physical libraries.
The government will recruit 38,800 teachers and support staff for the 740 Eklavya Model Residential Schools serving 3.5 lakh tribal students.

healthcare.text: Day Care Cancer Centres will be established in all District Hospitals to provide accessible cancer treatment.
The budget includes a significant allocation for the expansion of medical education, aiming to add 75,000 seats in the next five years.
A National Tele Mental Health Programme will be launched to provide quality mental health services across the country.
The 'Heal in India' initiative will be promoted to enhance medical tourism and position India as a global health destination.
A new program to promote research and innovation in pharmaceuticals will be launched, encouraging investment in research and development.
The government plans to eliminate sickle cell anemia by 2047 through awareness creation and universal screening of 7 crore people in affected tribal areas.
A mission to eliminate sickle cell anemia by 2047 will be launched, including awareness creation and universal screening of 7 crore people in affected tribal areas.
